page.title: 04HOME LIFE(CHILDREN)CALCOT,RG
page.content: Some children today are very fortunate in having enlightened and deeply caring and considerate parents.Some children return to empty homes with scant provision for their needs.These are called 'latch-key kids'.As parents try to cope with the pressures of life their children are sometimes at risk.Locally some children are badly abused. The increased wealth in some homes,due to second incomes,has meant that children often have very expensive possessions.Some have portable television sets,home computers,cassette-radios,electronic games and plenty of money to spend. In other homes children do not get enough to eat,and may not even have a bed to sleep in.In Calcot the extremes between those who have,and those who do not,are becoming more obvious.
